Make a table (for parts mean and standard deviation).

\(x\) \(\mathbb{P}[x]\) \(x\cdot\mathbb{P}[x]\) \(x-\mu\) \((x-\mu)^2\) \((x-\mu)^2 \cdot \mathbb{P}[x]\)
6 0.37 2.22 -5 25 9.25
10 0.14 1.4 -1 1 0.14
11 0.18 1.98 0 0 0
14 0.09 1.26 3 9 0.81
18 0.13 2.34 7 49 6.37
20 0.09 1.8 9 81 7.29
========= ========= ========= ========= ========= =========
\(\sum x \cdot \mathbb{P}[x] = 11\) \(\sigma^2 = 23.86\)
\(\mu = 11\) \(\sigma = 4.8846699\)

  1. 0.13
  2. \(0.14 + 0.13\) = 0.27
  3. \(0.14 \times 0.13\) = 0.0182
  4. 0.69
  5. \(\mu = 11\)
  6. \(\sigma = 4.8846699\)
